Comment: The Tennessee Star learned on Wednesday that Kilmar Abrego Garcia, an alleged member of the Central American gang Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) who was deported to El Salvador under President Donald Trump amid legal action claiming the removal was by mistake, was suspected of being engaged in human trafficking by a Tennessee Highway Patrol (THP) officer who detained him in December 2022, leading the THP to contact the FBI for guidance. Within two hours, the FBI ultimately requested the THP release Garcia and the passengers in his vehicle. THP complied with the request.
Author: Sure-Wishbone-4293

Author: Beware_the_silent

Comment: No need to apologize.  The Supreme Court ruling ‘facilitate his return’ only means for the US to make it easier for his return IF El Salvadorian president first releases him from prison, then either smuggles him into the US or grants him a visa which has to be agreed by both El Salvador and the US.  The Supreme Court ruling is basically saying we have no power to return him but should the El Salvador president allow it, the US government should make it easier but doesn’t have to because the legislative branch holds no power over foreign affairs. All in all it’s a nothing burger that maintains the status quo.  Trump is in the right and the district judge overstepped his authority and imo should be impeached
